videoDescription:

Full Docker Tutorial | Complete Docker Course | Hands-on course with a lot of demos and explaining the concepts behind, so that you really understand it.

#docker #dockertutorial #techworldwithnana

By the end, you will have a deep understanding of the concepts and a great overall big picture of how Docker is used in the whole software development process. 
The course is a mix of animated theoretic explanation and hands-on demo’s to follow along, so you get your first hands-on experience with Docker and feel more confident using it in your project.

videoTitle: Docker Tutorial for Beginners - A Full DevOps Course on How to Run Applications in Containers
videoDescription:
Get started using Docker with this end-to-end beginners course with hands-on labs.

Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications, whether on laptops, data center VMs, or the cloud.

In this course you will learn Docker through a series of lectures that use animation, illustration and some fun analogies that simply complex concepts, we have demos that will show how to install and get started with Docker and most importantly we have hands-on labs that you can access right in your browser. 

💻 Practice Labs: https://bit.ly/3IxaqRN

🔗 KodeKloud Website: https://www.kodekloud.com

videoTitle: What is DevOps? - In Simple English
videoDescription:
Simple explanation of DevOps without the complications and information overload.  -- what do you think? Please share & comment! 

DevOps is a concept with different interpretations and definitions, but when you get down to it, it's all about developers and operations teams breaking down silos and working together to innovate faster. For many companies, the ability to innovate at a rapid pace — responding to market conditions and customer feedback — is a key factor for success. Adopting the DevOps philosophy requires a new mindset, new tools and new skills.

videoTitle: DevOps Engineering Course for Beginners
videoDescription:
What is DevOps in the context of software engineering? Learn all about DevOps in this comprehensive course for beginners with three technical tutorials. You will learn what DevOps is, continuous integration, continuous deployment strategies, and application performance management. Many DevOps practices are commonly used in programming and web development, it is important to understand key terms and technologies. 

This course often references the MERN (MongoDB, Express JS, React JS, Node JS) technology stack. You will get a series of talks with technology recommendations based on these best practices. There will be several programming examples embedded in these talks. As long as you know the absolute basics of coding and the web, you'll have no problem following along. 

⭐️ Course Notes ⭐️
🔗 Lesson 1: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-devops/
🔗 Lesson 2: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-test-driven-development/

🔗 Lesson 5: https://layerci.com/blog/linting-best-practices/
🔗 Lesson 6: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-an-ephemeral-environment/

🔗 Lesson 12: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-log-aggregation/
🔗 Lesson 13: https://layerci.com/blog/vital-production-metrics/

videoDescription:
🔥𝐄𝐝𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐤𝐚 𝐃𝐞𝐯𝐎𝐩𝐬 Professional Certificate 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐏𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐮𝐞 𝐔𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐲: https://www.edureka.co/executive-programs/purdue-devops
This Edureka DevOps Tutorial for Beginners talks about What is DevOps and how it works. You will learn about several DevOps tools (Git, Jenkins, Docker, Puppet, Ansible, Nagios) involved at different DevOps stages such as version control, continuous integration, continuous delivery, continuous deployment, continuous monitoring. Below are the topics covered in DevOps Tutorial for Beginners:

1. Traditional Waterfall Model
2. Limitations of Waterfall Model
3. What is Agile methodology?
4. Limitations of Agile Methodology
5. What is DevOps?

#Edureka #EdurekaDevOps #DevOpsTutorial #DevOpsTools #DevOpsTraining #Git #Jenkins #Docker #Puppet #Nagios #DevOpsUseCase

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

About the Course
Edureka’s DevOps online training is designed to help you master key tools of Devops lifecycle like Docker, Puppet, Jenkins, Nagios, GIT, Ansible, SaltStack and Chef used by a DevOps Engineer for automating multiple steps in SDLC. During this course, our expert DevOps instructors will help you:

1. Understand the concepts and necessities of DevOps
2. Understand the need for DevOps and the day-to-day real-life problems it resolves
3. Learn installation and configuration of common infrastructure servers like Apache, and Nginx for the Enterprise
4. Learn popular DevOps tools like Jenkins, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, SaltStack, Nagios and GIT
5. Implement automated system update, installations and deployments 
6. Learn Virtualization Concepts 
7. Configuration deployment and packaging, continuous integration using GIT
8. Fine tune Performance and set-up basic Security for Infrastructure 
9. Manage server operations using Code which is popularly known as Infrastructure as a Code
10. Understand the need for and concepts of Monitoring and Logging. 

Along with the above mentioned topics, to help you master the most popular DevOps tools, you will also receive 3 additional self-paced courses including presentations, class recordings, assignments, solutions for the following tools:

1: Ansible - Covers Introduction, Setup & Configuration, Ansible Playbooks, 37 Ansible Modules, Different Roles and Command Line usage. 2: Chef - Covers Introduction, Building the Cook Book, Node Object & Search, Data-bags, Chef environment, Roles, Deploying Nodes in Production and using the Open Source Chef Server.

3: Puppet - Covers Puppet Infrastructure & run-cycle, the Puppet Language, Environment defining Nodes and Modules, Provisioning a Web Server and Executing Modules Against A Puppet Master.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Who should go for this course?
DevOps practitioners are among the highest paid IT professionals today, and the market demand for them is growing rapidly. With emergence of new job roles around DevOps philosophy, anyone aspiring to get into these new roles, can take up this DevOps course. Some of these roles are:

1. DevOps Architect
2. Automation Engineer
3. Software Tester
4. Security Engineer
5. Integration Specialist
6. Release Manager

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Project Work
1. Host a dummy webpage using Apache Web Server.
2. Write shell script which reports:
a) Various system configurations related to the user and the OS.
b) Data related to load on the server.
c) Top 5 processes with maximum number of threads.
d) Sort the services by memory
3. Install Nagios on a VM node for monitoring the various parameter of the VM.

videoTitle: Cloud Engineer vs DevOps Engineer - Differences and Overlaps of tasks and responsibilities
videoDescription:
Differences and Overlaps of Cloud and DevOps Engineer Roles as well as deep dive of Cloud Engineer Tasks and Responsibilities

DevOps engineer and Cloud engineer are 2 popular roles in software engineering. But there is a lot of mix up of these two roles and many people and many companies often use them interchangeably. They mix the tasks and responsibilities of these two very often. For example there are plenty of job descriptions for "DevOps Cloud Engineer" or "Cloud DevOps Engineer", which would naturally make you think that they are the same role, but then why would you have two names for the same role? And that's exactly what I'm going to discuss and clarify in this video.


🔗💡  What is DevOps and DevOps Engineer Tasks and Responsibilities

videoTitle: What is Platform Engineering and how it fits into DevOps and Cloud world
videoDescription:
Platform Engineering - What it is, how it works and how it fits into DevOps and Cloud world
Also how to approach implementing an IDP - internal developer platform.

🔗💚   Become a DevOps Engineer in 6 months       ►   https://bit.ly/3WKUPGf
🔗💙   Become a Kubernetes Administrator              ►   https://bit.ly/3IMJUWI
🔗🧡   Complete GitLab CI/CD course                        ►   https://bit.ly/42itb4B
🔗 💜  DevSecOps Bootcamp                                       ►   https://bit.ly/3OI6y66

▬▬▬▬▬▬ Thank you Pulumi for sponsoring this video 👏  ▬▬▬▬▬▬
►   Learn more about Pulumi's Internal developer platform-in-a-box: https://pulumip.us/IDP-Platform-Engineering
►   Join PulumiUp - a global Infrastructure as Code conference: https://www.pulumi.com/pulumi-up/

In this video we're going to talk about a relatively new hot topic in DevOps and Cloud space, which is “platform engineering”. There is a lot of discussion going on, where some people are asking whether platform engineering replaces DevOps. Many people say it goes hand in hand and is rather an addition to DevOps, but in reality it's a bit more complicated than that. Platform engineering actually changes a lot of established rules we knew about DevOps, SRE and Cloud engineering, it changes the game and introduces some new rules.

So let's clearly define, what platform engineering exactly is, more interestingly, why was there even a need for this new role and how it evolved and of course how it compares to DevOps and Cloud engineering and does it really replace any of these roles?


▬▬▬▬▬▬ T I M E S T A M P S ⏰  ▬▬▬▬▬▬

0:50 - Why Platform Engineering? Issue in traditional and DevOps teams

09:09 - Non-functional requirements
10:55 - What Platform Engineering is responsible for?
15:47 - How Platform Engineering works? Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
17:53 - How it looks in real-world?
22:33 - Flexibility with Infrastructure as Code
24:30 - How to implement an IDP successfully
30:14 - Platform Engineering vs DevOps
34:53 - Both Skills in TWN education
39:33 - Platform vs Cloud Engineer
41:01 - Wrap Up

videoTitle: Entendendo "Devops" para Iniciantes em Programação (Parte 1) | Série "Começando aos 40"
videoDescription:
Finalmente chegamos no tema final da série! Vamos falar um pouco sobre o tal do "devops".

Esta parte meio que depende dos conceitos que vimos nos últimos episódios então se você é iniciante, e ainda não assistiu os anteriores, recomendo que faça isso.

No episódio de hoje quero dar um pouco do contexto histórico, dos anos 90 até os anos 2000, indo de configuração manual de máquinas, hospedagens compartilhadas, virtualização até os VPS. Vamos entender como uma coisa foi levando pra próxima.

Muita gente confunde muitos termos, virtualização, paravirtualização, jails, containers, hypervisors e não sabe o que é o que, então eu vou distinguir tudo pra vocês finalmente entenderem.


Podcast: https://anchor.fm/dashboard/episode/ebvp1r
Transcript: https://www.akitaonrails.com/2019/04/10/akitando-47-entendendo-devops-para-iniciantes-em-programacao-parte-1-serie-comecando-aos-40

channelDescription:
GitHub is the AI-powered developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

The GitHub platform is where developers can create, share, and ship the best code possible. Our community is made up of students, hobbyists, consultants, enterprise professionals, partners, and executives, building software in the way that works best for them.

GitHub is much more than code. It is the home of open-source collaboration. It is where new developers get started and where experienced developers expand their knowledge. It is a community where developers come together to solve the unsolvable and test the limits of what software can do.

 #edureka #DevOpsEdureka #DevOps #whatisdevops #DevOpsCertificationTraining #devopstutorialsforbeginners 

-------------------

About These Courses

Edureka’s DevOps online training is designed to help you master key tools of DevOps lifecycle like Docker, Puppet, Jenkins, Nagios, GIT, Ansible, SaltStack, and Chef used by a DevOps Engineer for automating multiple steps in SDLC. During this course, our expert DevOps instructors will help you:
1. Understand the concepts and necessities of DevOps
2. Understand the need for DevOps and the day-to-day real-life problems it resolves
3. Learn installation and configuration of common infrastructure servers like Apache, and Nginx for the Enterprise
4. Learn popular DevOps tools like Jenkins, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, SaltStack, Nagios, and GIT
5. Implement automated system update, installations, and deployments
6. Learn Virtualization Concepts
7. Configuration deployment and packaging, continuous integration using GIT
8. Fine-tune Performance and set-up basic Security for Infrastructure
9. Manage server operations using Code which is popularly known as Infrastructure as a Code
10. Understand the need for and concepts of Monitoring and Logging.

Along with the above-mentioned topics, to help you master the most popular DevOps tools, you will also receive 3 additional self-paced courses including presentations, class recordings, assignments, solutions for the following tools:
1: Ansible - Covers Introduction, Setup & Configuration, Ansible Playbooks, 37 Ansible Modules, Different Roles and Command Line usage.
2: Chef - Covers Introduction, Building the Cook Book, Node Object & Search, Data-bags, Chef environment, Roles, Deploying Nodes in Production and using the Open Source Chef Server.
3: Puppet - Covers Puppet Infrastructure & run-cycle, the Puppet Language, Environment defining Nodes and Modules, Provisioning a Web Server and Executing Modules Against A Puppet Master. 
-------------------

Who should go for this course?

DevOps practitioners are among the highest paid IT professionals today, and the market demand for them is growing rapidly. With the emergence of new job roles around DevOps philosophy, anyone aspiring to get into these new roles can take up this DevOps course. Some of these roles are:

1. DevOps Architect

2. Automation Engineer

3. Software Tester

4. Security Engineer

5. Integration Specialist

6. Release Manager

-------------------

videoTitle: DevOps Interview Questions & Answers! (How to PASS a DevOps Engineer Interview!)
videoDescription:
DevOps Interview Questions & Answers by Richard McMunn of: https://passmyinterview.com/devops-engineer-interview/
#devops #devopsengineer #devopsinterviewquestions
In this interview tips training tutorial, Richard McMunn will cover:

1. A list of DEVOPS interview questions I recommend you prepare for;
2. Example ANSWERS to help you PASS your DevOps Engineer interview;
3. The QUALITIES you MUST demonstrate during your DevOps interview;
4. Further resources to help you PASS your DevOps Engineer interview!

HERE'S A FULL LIST OF DEVOPS ENGINEER INTERVIEW QUESTIONS
Q1. Tell me about yourself and why you want to work in this DevOps role?
Q2. What are the most important skills and qualities needed to work as a DevOps Engineer?
Q3. Why do you want to work for our organization in this DevOps role?
Q4. Tell me about the hardest day you’ve had as a DevOps Engineer?
Q5. What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Q6. You are giving a presentation to a number of non-technical company managers. They have no technical knowledge and they are struggling to understand your presentation. How would you adapt your presentation, so they all understand?
Q7. Where do you see yourself in the future?
Q8. How do you handle stress and pressure at work?
Q9. What does DevOps mean to you and what is its purpose in our organization?
Q10. Tell me how DevOps differs from Agile / SDLC?
Q11. What is an inode on Linux?
Q12. In your opinion, which are the top DevOps tools and what are they used for?
Q13. Tell me how you'd go about optimizing a database?
Q14. What is garbage collection programming?
Q15. Talk me through the steps you would follow when checking physical memory on Linux?

videoTitle: How AI is Changing DevOps Careers | What You Need to Know
videoDescription:

► Grab your DevOps Starter Kit: https://bit.ly/4oZ4qGD
► Skills Companies ACTUALLY Want: https://youtu.be/7d3MU2DgUPg

In this video I sat down with Bret Fisher - Docker Captain and DevOps educator who spent 2 years walking around conferences asking engineers one question: Are you actually using AI in DevOps?

The disconnect between what people say online and what's really happening will surprise you.

We break down:
- the AI hype vs reality
- what AI can actually do for DevOps RIGHT NOW (not in 5 or 10 years)

Plus: why companies still want Kubernetes experts, not AI prompt engineers.

Those new to the Programming and DevOps world often find it challenging to start their journey due to the missing basic prerequisites. For example, issues with setting up a basic lab environment using VirtualBox, problems with networking, or trouble with working with the Linux CLI or text editors like vi editor. Sometimes there are issues with applications - like getting a sample application to work, problems with getting the dependencies to install correctly or trouble with getting a web server to communicate with a database server. videoTitle: Will AI replace DevOps Engineer? AI tools in DevOps 2024
videoDescription:
AI for DevOps | Will AI replace DevOps engineers | DevOps AI tools
In this DevOps video we will learning How AI and ML can be used in DevOps tasks like CICD, Monitoring, Logging, Deployments and more.
Along with Popular AI tools in devops and companies using AI with Devops.

Connect with me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nasiullha-chaudhari/ 

AI and DevOps are two fascinating fields in the tech world, and they're coming together in exciting ways. Many companies are exploring how AI can help improve their DevOps practices to make things smoother and more efficient.

With AI, we can automate repetitive tasks, optimize resource usage, and make better decisions.

A common question is whether AI will replace DevOps or the engineers working in this area. Well, AI can certainly enhance DevOps, but it won't replace the people. Instead, it will work alongside skilled DevOps engineers to make things even better.

Timestamps
Intro 0"00
Eminem Featuring 0:50
DevOps Tasks that AI can replace 01:20
Popular AI tools in DevOps 03:25
Companies using AI in DevOps 04:40
How Netflix AI with DevOps 04:48
How Google uses AI in Devops 04:58
How LinkedIn uses AI for DevOps 05:16
Problems when using AI for DevOps 05:47
Outro 07:26

The GitLab Developer Survey, available at https://about.gitlab.com/developer-survey/ 

AI Tools for DevOps:
1. Splunk
2. Harness
3. Amazon CodeGuru
4. PagerDuty
5. Dynatrace
6. Datadog
7. AppDynamics
8. Opsani
9. Puppet
10. Chef

These AI-powered tools, combined with popular DevOps platforms, enable organizations to accelerate their software development and delivery processes while ensuring greater reliability, scalability, and performance. The integration of AI in DevOps brings innovative solutions to complex challenges, allowing teams to focus on creating value for their customers.

1. Netflix: Netflix is well-known for its use of AI and machine learning to optimize content delivery, personalization, and infrastructure management in their DevOps workflows.
2. Google: Google has been a pioneer in AI research and has integrated AI tools and technologies into their DevOps processes to improve system performance and operational efficiency.
3. Facebook: Facebook uses AI and machine learning algorithms to optimize infrastructure, manage user data, and streamline their continuous deployment practices in DevOps.
4. Amazon: Amazon's AWS offers various AI-powered DevOps tools and services, such as Amazon CodeGuru, AWS CodePipeline, and AWS CodeDeploy, to help developers automate tasks and improve software delivery.
5. Microsoft: Microsoft uses AI in their DevOps workflows to optimize Azure services, automate infrastructure management, and enhance developer productivity.
6. Spotify: Spotify uses AI-driven analytics and monitoring tools to gain insights into application performance and user behavior, enabling continuous improvements in their DevOps practices.
7. Twitter: Twitter employs AI and machine learning for infrastructure management, incident detection, and performance optimization in their DevOps pipelines.
8. Uber: Uber utilizes AI to manage large-scale infrastructure, improve data analysis
9. Airbnb: Airbnb leverages AI to optimize their continuous deployment and delivery pipelines
10. IBM: IBM has integrated AI technologies into their DevOps tools and solutions, such as IBM Cloud Pak for Applications, to facilitate intelligent automation and faster software delivery.

Adoption of AI in DevOps is not limited to these companies alone. More and more companies are embracing AI in their DevOps processes. By doing so, they can reduce manual work, spot issues faster, and deliver higher-quality software to their customers.

In conclusion, AI and DevOps make a fantastic team. They bring exciting possibilities for the future of software development, making it more efficient and effective. Embracing AI in DevOps can give your company a competitive edge in the tech world. So, let's welcome this exciting partnership!

videoTitle: DevOps Project: Mastering VPC Creation with Terraform & GitHub Actions Automation
videoDescription:
► ▬▬▬▬▬▬ About🧾 ▬▬▬▬▬▬
In this tutorial video, we'll walk you through creating a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure using Terraform and then automating the deployment of your Terraform code using GitHub Actions. Whether you're new to infrastructure as code (IAC) or looking to streamline your deployment workflow, this video covers all of it.🚀

Here's what you can expect to learn:
1. Setting up Terraform: We'll guide you through the initial setup of Terraform on your local machine, ensuring you have the necessary tools and configurations in place.🛠️

2. Writing Terraform Code: You'll see how to write Terraform code to define your VPC infrastructure, including networks, subnets, security groups, and more. We'll provide clear explanations and best practices along the way.📝

3. Initializing and Applying Terraform: Learn how to initialize your Terraform project and apply your code to create the VPC in your cloud provider.🌟

4. GitHub Repository Setup: We'll guide you through setting up a GitHub repository to store your Terraform code, including creating a README, .gitignore, and other essential files.📂

5. GitHub Actions Configuration: Discover how to configure GitHub Actions workflows to automate the deployment of your Terraform code. We'll cover secrets management and workflow triggers on pushing the code to a specific branch.⚙️

6. Push to GitHub: See how to push your Terraform code to your GitHub repository and trigger the GitHub Actions workflow.📦

7. Monitor and Verify: Learn how to monitor the progress of your GitHub Actions workflow and verify the successful deployment of your VPC infrastructure.🧐

By the end of this video, you'll have a solid understanding of how to create and manage infrastructure using Terraform and how to automate the deployment process with GitHub Actions. videoTitle: What Is DevOps? | How To Implement? | Benefits of Implementing DevOps | Malayalam
videoDescription:
What is DevOps? | How To Implement? | Benefits of Implementing DevOps | Malayalam

Introducing DevOps is becoming a major steps in any new age software development life cycle. This video will give you what is DevOps and how to implement DevOps in each phases of Software Development Cycle such as 

1. Planning phase
2. Coding Phase
3. Build Phase
4. Continuous Testing 
5. Continuous Deployment 
6. Continuous Monitoring 
7. Continuous Integration 

Also discussing why an organization should introduce DevOps approach and the various benefits they could achieve by rolling out ‘DevOps’. The key benefits are 

•Ensure faster deployment.
•Stabilize work environment.
•Significant improvement in product quality.
•Automation in repetitive tasks leaves more room for innovation.
•Promotes agility in your business.
•Continuous delivery of software.
•Fast and reliable problem-solving techniques 

Finally a brief intro about waterfall model and the importance of switching to agile approach in software development and DevOps is an extension to the agile approach.

videoTitle: Introducing AWS DevOps Agent (Preview) | Amazon Web Services
videoDescription:
AWS DevOps Agent (preview) is a frontier agent that resolves and proactively prevents incidents, continuously improving reliability and performance. AWS DevOps Agent investigates incidents and identifies operational improvements as an experienced DevOps engineer would: by learning your resources and their relationships; working with your observability tools, runbooks, code repositories, and CI/CD pipelines; and correlating telemetry, code, and deployment data across all of them to understand the relationships between your application resources. DevOps Agent uses this deep understanding of your operations and workloads to reduce MTTR and drive operational excellence.

Learn more about AWS DevOps Agent: https://go.aws/devops-agent

videoTitle: DevOps ที่แท้จริงเป็นยังไง? | Career Lab EP.1 (Part 1)
videoDescription:
ทำไมแต่ละองค์กรถึงให้นิยามความหมายของ DevOps ไม่เหมือนกัน แม้กระทั่ง JD ของอาชีพ DevOps Engineer แต่ละที่ยังแตกต่างกันอย่างสิ้นเชิง

ถ้า DevOps คือแนวคิด ไม่ใช่ตำแหน่งงานแล้ว จะหยิบจับใครมาเป็น DevOps Engineer ก็ได้จริงหรือ? 🤫

ร่วมฟังความคิดเห็นจาก 2 มุม 2 สายอาชีพ 👨🏻‍💼 ตัวแทนทีม Software Developer โดยคุณปุ๋ย สมเกียรติ ปุ๋ยสูงเนิน - Technical Coach ที่สยามชำนาญกิจ  👨🏻‍💼 และตัวแทนทีม Operation หรือ DevOps Engineer, SRE, Platform Engineer โดยคุณเดียร์ จิรายุส นิ่มแสง - ผู้ก่อตั้ง และ CEO ของ Opsta (Thailand)

รายการ Career Lab รายการที่สำรวจและเจาะลึก insight ต่าง ๆ ของอาชีพที่ in-demand ที่สุดในตอนนี้ เราจำนำพา Expert ตัวท้อปขมานั่งเม้าท์ฉ่ำกับประเด็นสุดร้อนแรงแบบไม่มีกั๊ก และไม่เคยพูดถึงที่ไหนมาก่อน !!

✅ กว่า 70% ของ DevOps Engineer ในปัจจุบันไม่ใช่ DevOps ที่แท้จริง?
✅ DevOps (อาจ) ไม่มีอยู่จริง จริง ๆ แล้วคือ Platform Engineering
✅ องค์กรจะปรับตัว Transform ในการทำ DevOps ที่แท้จริงได้อย่างไร?
✅ โลกของ DevOps การทำงานจริง ใครควรรับผิดชอบอะไร ทั้งในมุมของทีม Software Dev และทีม DevOps Engineer, SRE, หรือ Platform Engineer?
✅ Team Lead หรือ Tech Manager ควรจะแก้ปัญหา ความไม่เข้าใจกันระหว่างทีมพัฒนาในองค์กรอย่างไร?

💡 อย่าลืมกด Subscribe และ เปิด 🔔 แจ้งเตือนเพื่อไม่ให้พลาด Contents ดีๆ จาก Skooldio

DevOps is not only a product but a practice, a culture and a mindset. Most importantly, it is for everyone! DevOps methodologies enable collaboration and transparency. Here we’ll deliver content on the various technologies that enable DevOps on Azure.

videoTitle: What is Containerization in Devops explained
videoDescription:
Defined by the placement of a software component and its environment, dependencies, and configuration into an isolated unit called a container, containerization makes it possible to deploy an application consistently on any computing environment, whether on-premises or cloud-based.

videoTitle: Jenkins Full Course in One Shot | Zero to Pro CI/CD (6+ Hours) + 3 Real Projects | DevOps Tutorial
videoDescription:
#theshubhamgour 

🚀 Welcome to the Ultimate Jenkins CI/CD Course — in ONE SHOT!
This 6+ hour hands-on tutorial takes you from Zero → Pro in Jenkins with 3 real DevOps projects. Perfect for beginners, Release Engineers, DevOps aspirants, and software teams who want to automate builds, testing, and deployments efficiently.

🌟 What You Will Learn
✔ What is Jenkins? How does CI/CD work?
✔ Installing & configuring Jenkins on Windows & Linux
✔ Jenkins basics — UI, plugins, permissions, workspaces
✔ Jenkins Freestyle Jobs — build automation
✔ Pipeline as Code — Declarative & Scripted Pipelines
✔ Jenkinsfile from scratch — Stages, Agents & Steps
✔ Jenkins Shared Libraries for production workflows
✔ GitHub → Jenkins Webhooks automation
✔ Multi-Branch Pipelines for real DevOps environments

🧩 Real-World DevOps Projects Included
1️⃣ Python CI/CD pipeline with Docker
2️⃣ QA Automation pipeline triggered on commits
3️⃣ Java CI/CD pipeline with end-to-end automation

You will learn exactly how CI/CD works in companies — from code commit to deployment! 🔥

🎯 Who Should Watch This?
DevOps & Cloud beginners
Release/Build engineers
Students preparing for job interviews
Developers transitioning into CI/CD roles
Anyone learning automation for career growth

💪 What You’ll Achieve After This Course
✨ Build and automate pipelines end-to-end
✨ Integrate GitHub, Testing & Docker into CI/CD
✨ Manage Jenkins like a pro
✨ Add DevOps projects to your resume

videoTitle: How to Create a CI/CD Pipeline in Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
In this video, you’ll learn how to build a CI/CD pipeline in Azure DevOps from scratch! This tutorial will guide you through the entire process, helping you set up continuous integration and continuous delivery to automate your software development workflow.

This video has everything you need, whether you're new to DevOps or looking to refine your pipeline setup.

Timestamps:

00:00 – Introduction: What is CI/CD and why it's important
03:10 – Setting Up a Project in Azure DevOps: Step-by-step guide to creating a new project
07:40 – Connecting to a Git Repository: Version control setup with Git in Azure Repos
12:25 – Creating the Build Pipeline (CI): Configuring and automating builds
20:50 – Running Tests in the Pipeline: Integrating automated tests in your CI pipeline
27:30 – Creating the Release Pipeline (CD): Automating deployments for continuous delivery
35:15 – Deploying to Azure: Connecting your pipeline to deploy your application to Azure
41:50 – Monitoring and Managing Pipelines: Best practices for monitoring and troubleshooting
48:30 – Best Practices for CI/CD Pipelines: Tips to optimize your DevOps pipeline
54:10 – Conclusion: Final thoughts and next steps
By the end of this video, you'll have a fully functional CI/CD pipeline up and running in Azure DevOps, ready to streamline your development and deployment process!

videoTitle: What is the difference between DevOps and Platform Engineering?
videoDescription:
Confused about the disparities between DevOps and Platform Engineering? Wondering if Platform Engineering is just a rebranding of DevOps? In this video, we delve into the nuances and distinctions between these two critical disciplines. Discover how DevOps began and it's impact on end-to-end application deployment, and the emmergence of Platform Engineering and it's focus on building self-service toolchains and workflows for efficient software engineering in the cloud-native era. Learn why understanding these differences is essential for successful digital transformations.

videoTitle: No coding to DevOps Career: Market Trends, Salary Insights & DevOps Job Opportunities in Germany.
videoDescription:
Are you considering a career in DevOps or exploring new opportunities in the field? In this video, we dive deep into the current DevOps job market, explore salary expectations, and discuss how learning German can significantly boost your chances of landing a job in Germany.

What You’ll Learn:

Free and Paid Learning Resources: Discover where you can start learning DevOps, from free YouTube tutorials to paid courses.
Job Market Trends: Understand the current job market for DevOps professionals in India and Germany.
Salary Expectations: Get insights on expected salaries for fresh graduates and experienced professionals, including potential earnings in startups, medium-sized companies, and large corporations.
Application Tips: Learn how to prepare a compelling resume, the importance of cover letters, and strategies for applying to job portals and company career sites.
Motivation Matters: Find out why showing genuine interest and motivation can make a difference in your job application.
Key Takeaways:

DevOps offers numerous career opportunities, even without a formal background in the field.
Learning German can give you a significant edge in the German job market.
Salary expectations vary based on experience and company size, with high earning potential in large firms and consulting companies.
Subscribe for more insights into career development, industry trends, and tips for success. Share your questions and thoughts in the comments below!

Keywords:
DevOps career, DevOps job market, DevOps salary insights, DevOps opportunities in Germany, learning DevOps, DevOps courses, DevOps job application tips, salary expectations, motivation in job applications

videoTitle: C'est quoi le DevOps ? Tout comprendre en deux minutes ! CI/CD, feedback et qualité !
videoDescription:
De manière triviale, le DevOps est la contraction de développement et d'opérationnel. 

Au délà d'être une méthode, c'est avant tout une culture de l'amélioration continue ancrée dans les pratiques agiles. 

Dans cette vidéo César Mourot, le cofondateur de Code Insider vous explique le DevOps et tout les aspects qui le compose.

00:00 La contraction de Dev et opérationnel 
00:18 Une culture de l'amélioration continue
00:31 Le CI/CD Continuous integration / Continuous Deployement
00:51 Des feedbacks plus rapides
01:01 Une approche autour de la qualité
01:26 Une manière opérationnelle de rendre compte d'améliorations continues
01:59 La mise en place des méthodes agiles au quotidien
02:10 Prochaine vidéo

videoTitle: What Is DevOps?  - Explained With Real World Examples!
videoDescription:
Start your DevOps Career (Beginners - Advanced) - https://bit.ly/DevOpsLearningPath-YT

DevOps is a buzzword. It’s huge right now in the tech community, and it’s definitely becoming more central to how teams build software.
If you’re starting with DevOps, this video will help you understand the basics and give you a good head-start on your journey. You will also learn about the different stages in DevOps, what tools are needed at each stage, and how potential problems should be handled.

Start your DevOps Career (Beginners - Advanced) - https://bit.ly/DevOpsLearningPath-YT

In this video we will cover the following topics:

00:00 -  Introduction
00:27 - Problems before DevOps
01:33 - Two Stages of DevOps
02:12 - Real World Scenario 1
03:28 - Real World Scenario 2
04:12 - Automation
05:06 - Benefits of DevOps
06:10 - Summary
07:22 - Conclusion
 
Those new to the Programming and DevOps world often find it challenging to start their journey due to the missing basic prerequisites. For example, issues with setting up a basic lab environment using VirtualBox, problems with networking, or trouble with working with the Linux CLI or text editors like vi editor. Sometimes there are issues with applications - like getting a sample application to work, problems with getting the dependencies to install correctly or trouble with getting a web server to communicate with a database server. Or, at other times, it's working with data formats like JSON or YAML.

So we have identified a gap, and we believe that this is due to missing some of the basic prerequisites, such as knowing the basics of Linux, the basics of tools like VirtualBox, or knowing the basics of the most commonly used applications like Java, Python or NodeJS or web servers like Apache, NGINX etc. As a DevOps or Cloud Engineer, it is crucial to have these basics cleared. And that’s why we are helping you to bridge that gap!

Want to view a clear path to becoming a DevOps Engineer? Visit our website kodekloud.com!
We have various Learning Paths to help you choose your next step and shape your DevOps Career.

videoTitle: هل الـ DevOps engineers مطلوبين في الشركات؟
videoDescription: في الحلقة دي بنناقش كل التفاصيل المهمة عن عالم DevOps. هنتكلم عن اللي كان بيحصل في تطوير البرمجيات قبل ظهور الـ DevOps وإزاي غير المشهد تمامًا. كمان هنوضح الفرق بين DevOps وSRE، وليه بعض الشركات بتفضل تستخدم واحدة عن التانية. لو بتسأل عن فرص الشغل في المجال ده سواء في مصر أو بره، هتعرف حجم الفرص وأهميتها ومتوسط الرواتب اللي ممكن تحققها. الحلقة كمان بتجاوب على سؤال مهم: إيه اللي محتاج تعمله كخريج جديد عشان تبدأ في المجال؟ وهتديك نصايح عملية لكل اللي محتاج تكون مجهزه قبل ما تروح الإنترفيو. متفوتش الفرصة دي لو عايز تبدأ مشوارك في DevOps بخطوات ثابتة وواضحة.

videoTitle: DKT88 - DevOps Mock interview #6 (Senior/Lead DevOps engineer)
videoDescription:
Очередное мок-собеседование на канале! Сегодня в гостях Саша (не СТО) — Senior DevOps Engineer, с которым мы проходим по всему циклу разработки: от проектирования CI/CD до траблшутинга в Kubernetes. 
Много практики, лайв-кодинга и архитектурных вопросов.
Слушаем, запоминаем вопросы, влетаем за разбором на Patreon/Бусти!

🔍 ЧТО СПРАШИВАЛИ

- CI/CD: проектируем идеальный пайплайн для Java-бэкенда и спорим о порядке стейджей
- Git Internals: навигация по дереву коммитов (Detached HEAD) и правка истории
- Kubernetes: архитектура (Cluster API, Control Plane), чем на самом деле занимается Controller Manager и нюансы StatefulSet
- Troubleshooting: чиним права доступа (RBAC) в кластере и разбираем упавший Docker-билд с пропавшими пакетами
- Helm & IaC: зачем нужны Library charts, шаблонизация и структура Terraform-репозитория

⏱️ НАВИГАЦИЯ ПО ВИДЕО

00:00:00 - 🎬 Вступление и приветствие
00:01:15 - 👤 Представление гостя: Саша, Senior DevOps
00:02:37 - 📈 Карьерный путь: от SysAdmin к DevOps и K8s
🚀 ЧАСТЬ 1: CI/CD И Git
00:07:33 - Проектируем пайплайн для Java-приложения в GitLab CI
00:12:31 - Порядок стейджей: Lint, Test, SAST, Build — что важнее?
00:15:43 - Настройки репозитория и Branching Strategies
00:18:20 - Почему Feature branches лучше, чем commit в develop
00:24:30 - Задача: Git Visuals — навигация по дереву коммитов
🐳 ЧАСТЬ 2: Kubernetes
00:34:03 - Опыт с K8s: Self-hosted, Bare metal и Cluster API
00:41:00 - Сколько кластеров нужно для разработки? (Dev vs Prod)
00:42:41 - Компоненты Control Plane и роль Controller Manager
00:46:54 - Deployment vs StatefulSet: привязка PVC и реплики
00:51:58 - Topology Spread Constraints и Affinity
00:53:49 - Задача: Troubleshooting K8s (CrashLoopBackOff и RBAC)
📦 ЧАСТЬ 3: Helm & Docker
01:06:55 - Helm: Library charts, наследование чартов и Go templates
01:18:29 - Задача: Troubleshooting Docker-сборки (пропавший пакет в Ubuntu)
💻 ЧАСТЬ 4: Scription & IaC
01:35:11 - Скриптинг: парсинг OpenAPI спецификации (Bash/jq)
01:57:24 - Terraform: использование модулей и версионирование
02:04:07 - Как разделять окружения (Dev/Stage/Prod) в IaC
02:08:25 - Завершение интервью

videoTitle: DevOps vs. SRE
videoDescription:
What is the difference between DevOps and SRE? 

In Short, DevOps should be an all-encompassing term for connecting the development team and operations team. However, DevOps tends to focus more on Deployment, whereas SRE focuses on Reliability. 

Check out the whole video for more: https://youtu.be/NJsjrXgsBYo

videoTitle: DevOps in 2026: Stay in DevOps or Transition to MLOps, AIOps, DataOps?
videoDescription:
As we close out 2025, many DevOps engineers are facing the same question:
Should I continue growing in DevOps, or is it time to transition into MLOps, AIOps, or DataOps?

With AI agents and agentic workflows increasingly automating infrastructure and operations, it’s natural to wonder how these changes impact DevOps roles and career paths going into 2026.

In this video, I break down what’s actually changing — and what isn’t. You’ll get a clear, practical explanation of DevOps, MLOps, AIOps, and DataOps, how AI agents fit across all of these domains, and how to think about your career without chasing hype or fear-driven narratives.

What you’ll learn in this video:

Why DevOps is not dying, but evolving into specialized domains

The real difference between DevOps, MLOps, AIOps, and DataOps

Where AI agents and agentic workflows actually fit in operations

When it makes sense to stay in DevOps

When transitioning to MLOps, AIOps, or DataOps is the right move

Why these paths are not mutually exclusive

How to choose a direction based on the problems that genuinely excite you

This video is designed for engineers who want clarity, not clickbait — and who want to make career decisions grounded in real systems, real demand, and real interest.

If this helped you understand where the industry is heading, consider subscribing. In upcoming videos, I’ll go deeper into each specialization — DevOps, MLOps, AIOps, and DataOps — with real-world context and practical insights.

#DevOps #MLOps #AIOps #DataOps #DevOpsCareer #AIAgents #AgenticWorkflows #CloudEngineering #FutureOfDevOps

videoTitle: DKT87 - Разбор Technology Radar #33: AI, MCP, Context Engineering и будущее DevOps
videoDescription:
ThoughtWorks Technology Radar #33 —  обзор трендов IT-ишечке! Разбираем ключевые техники, инструменты и платформы, которые изменят вашу работу в 20265 году. От pre-commit hooks до vLLM — всё, что нужно знать DevOps об AI.

О ЧЁМ ВЫПУСК:
• AI Infrastructure Orchestration — GPU-кластеры, NVIDIA DCGM, RDMA и почему это важно для каждого
• MCP (Model Context Protocol) — эра AI-агентов и интеграции с внешними системами
• Context Engineering — кладезь ресурсов от Anthropic для работы с LLM
• Pre-commit Hooks + Continuous Compliance — защита от утечек секретов и антипаттернов AI
• Sidecar-less Service Mesh (Istio Ambient) — MTLS без оверхеда
• Vibe Coding в Hold — почему Shadow IT ускоряется через AI и чем это грозит
• ARM, Graviton 5, VLLM, Crossplane, N8N и другие инструменты в Adopt/Trial/Assess

Если вы не знаете, что такое Context Engineering, Agent MD или Spec-driven Development — этот выпуск для вас. Прямо сейчас нужно догонять!

videoTitle: How to Create Cron Jobs in Azure DevOps Pipelines  | Automate Your Workflow

videoTitle: GitHub vs GitLab: Which DevOps Platform is Best for Your Project?
videoDescription:
The ultimate fight for the modern developer workflow comes down to two giants: GitHub and GitLab. They both start with Git, but their fundamental philosophies on how you build, test, and deploy software couldn't be more different. Are you better off with GitHub's flexible "Best-of-Breed" Marketplace approach, or is GitLab's unified, "All-in-One" DevSecOps platform the right choice for your enterprise?

In this comprehensive comparison, I break down the core features, CI/CD platforms (GitHub Actions vs. GitLab CI/CD), security models, and hosting flexibility to help you make the definitive decision for your team, whether you're working on open-source, a complex enterprise pipeline, or a heavily regulated project.

Watch the full video to find out which platform is the absolute best fit for your specific needs!

What do you think? Which platform are you using for your current project and why? Let me know in the comments below!

If you enjoy the video,  like it, and subscribe to my channel!
See you in the next video!

videoTitle: Authentic DevOps with AI Foundry + GitHub, on Sip & Sync with Azure
videoDescription:
Join us for another exciting episode of Sip and Sync with Azure! ☁️🎤 Host Katie Novotny welcomes Krystal Folkes, Software Global Black Belt at Microsoft, to explore how Azure AI Foundry agents can revolutionize DevOps workflows by integrating with GitHub and GitHub Copilot.
In this hands-on demo, Krystal walks through building a security-focused agent using MCP tools, connecting to GitHub's advanced security advisories, and orchestrating multi-agent workflows—all from a local machine. Whether you're a DevOps engineer, security lead, or developer curious about AI-powered automation, this episode is packed with insights to elevate your developer experience.

What You'll Learn:

- How to build a security agent using Azure AI Foundry
- Connecting GitHub MCP tools to automate vulnerability insights
- Using GitHub Copilot to fine-tune prompts for agent instructions
- Running agents locally with secure GitHub token authentication
- Orchestrating multi-agent workflows for DevOps, planning, and documentation
- Leveraging Azure Key Vault and managed identity for secure integrations

videoTitle: D365 F&O: Full Dev Environment Setup (LCS, DevOps, VM) | Part 1
videoDescription:
Set up a complete D365 F&O project from scratch. Learn to configure Lifecycle Services (LCS), Azure DevOps, and a local development VM.

───────────
🕒 Timestamps
───────────

0:00 → Intro & Project Overview
1:03 → Business Scenario: Bluestone Industrial Components (BIC)
2:05 → Video Goal: The Development Foundation
2:25 → Part 1: Lifecycle Services (LCS) Setup
3:01 → Creating a new LCS Implementation Project
5:19 → Understanding the LCS Project Dashboard
7:03 → Part 2: Azure DevOps (ADO) Setup
7:30 → Creating a new ADO Organization
8:22 → Configuring Organization Settings for LCS (TFVC & Classic Pipelines)
10:26 → Creating a new ADO Project (TFVC)
11:37 → Understanding the ADO Project Interface
13:16 → Part 3: Connecting LCS and Azure DevOps
13:34 → Starting the LCS Project Onboarding Wizard
16:39 → Defining the Project Team
17:58 → Defining Project Milestones
19:00 → Generating an ADO Personal Access Token (PAT)
20:34 → Linking LCS to the ADO Project
22:10 → Part 4: Configuring the Azure Subscription
22:54 → Granting "Contributor" role to Dynamics Deployment Services
25:04 → Creating the Azure Connector in LCS
27:41 → Part 5: Deploying a Cloud Sandbox Environment
28:17 → Configuring Deployment Settings
30:40 → Monitoring Deployment & Logging In
31:42 → Part 6: Setting Up a Local Development VM
31:42 → Downloading the VHD from Shared Asset Library
32:45 → Extracting the VHD files
33:56 → Enabling Hyper-V in Windows Features
34:40 → Creating a new Virtual Machine in Hyper-V
36:17 → Attaching the VHD file
37:04 → Starting and Connecting to the VM
37:27 → Part 7: Configuring VM Authentication
37:58 → Creating an Azure App Registration
38:48 → Running the Self-Signed Certificate PowerShell Script
39:30 → Running the Admin User Provisioning Tool
40:14 → Accessing F&O Locally via IIS
41:29 → Recap

──────────────
💡 What You'll Learn
──────────────

✓ How to provision a new Lifecycle Services (LCS) implementation project.
✓ Configure Azure DevOps for D365 (including TFVC & Classic Pipeline settings).
✓ The critical step of connecting LCS to Azure DevOps for integration.
✓ How to deploy and access a local development VHD using Hyper-V.
✓ Authenticate the local VM using Azure App Registration.

──────────────────────────
🚀 About This D365 Development Series
──────────────────────────

This series goes beyond basic tutorials to show you how real-world Dynamics 365 (D365FO) projects are built from start to finish. We'll build a complete, end-to-end "Automated Customer Tiering System" for a fictional client, Bluestone Industrial Components (BIC).

You'll see every step of a production-ready solution, from setup to deployment, covering:
➤ Core X++ Development: Extending tables and forms (CustTable), creating Enums, and implementing custom business logic using Chain of Command (CoC).
➤ Automation: Building robust, automated batch jobs with the SysOperation Framework.
➤ APIs & Integration: Creating Data Entities to build secure OData REST APIs and for Data Management Framework (DMF) exports.
➤ Event-Driven Architecture: Firing real-time alerts from D365 to Azure Logic Apps using Business Events.
➤ Business Intelligence: Connecting D365 to Power BI to build an interactive sales dashboard.
➤ DevOps & ALM: Setting up a complete CI/CD pipeline in Azure DevOps, managing source control (TFVC), and automating builds.

────────────────
💻 Tools & Technologies
────────────────

🔹Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365FO)
🔹X++
🔹Visual Studio 2019
🔹Lifecycle Services (LCS)
🔹Azure DevOps (ADO)
🔹SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
🔹Power BI Desktop
🔹Azure Logic Apps

───────────────────
💬 Feedback & Future Topics
───────────────────

This series covers the core components of a practical, end-to-end D365 project. I know there are many more topics we could dive into, from advanced debugging to complex form patterns.

I welcome your feedback and ideas! If there's a specific D365 topic you'd like to see covered in a future video, please share your suggestions in the comments section below.

#Dynamics365, #D365Development, #LifecycleServices, #AzureDevOps

videoTitle: DevOps Topologies 10 years on: What have we learned about silos, collaboration, and flow?
videoDescription:
Keynote at The DEVOPS Conference Global - London, on March 2024: DevOps Topologies 10 years on: What have we learned about silos, collaboration, and flow?

----
 
In this talk, Matthew Skelton explores the key learnings from 10 years of Team Topologies and State of DevOps Reports and outlines key steps that organizations can take to improve IT delivery performance:

- Organize for flow
- Address team cognitive load
- Estimate the cost of “tangled software”
- Use the Accelerate metrics and community techniques to find good boundaries for flow 
- Develop secure foundations in social and technical practices that support fast flow
- Take a realistic view about the nature and scale of change needed

By combining learnings from State of DevOps Reports and Team Topologies together with principles championed by the DevOps community, organizations can navigate a route to business agility via a fast flow operating model.

----

Speaker: Matthew Skelton, Co-author of Team Topologies, and CEO at Conflux

Matthew Skelton is co-author of the award-winning and ground-breaking book Team Topologies, and Founder & Principal at Conflux. The Team Topologies book was rated one of the ‘Best product management books of all time’ by Book Authority and is widely used by organizations worldwide to transform the way they deliver value.

Matthew is one of the foremost leaders in modern organizational dynamics for fast flow, drawing on Team Topologies and related practices to support organizations with transformation towards a sustainable fast flow of value and true business agility. 

A Chartered Engineer (CEng), Matthew brings together principles and practices from multiple disciplines for a holistic approach to digitally-enriched operating models. He combines his experience as a leader and software architect in multiple contexts (GOV.UK, ecommerce, financial services, telecoms, pharma, retail, robotics, etc.) with a strong interest in the human side of organizations for a compassionate and humanistic approach to organizational effectiveness. #DevOps #thedevopsconference 

----

👇 Learn more:
https://www.thedevopsconference.com/global?utm_campaign=The%20DEVOPS%20Conference%2022&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=speaker-video-tdoc-global-2024

If you'd like to learn more about DevOps transformations, check out our page on the topic here:
https://www.eficode.com/devops-transformation?utm_campaign=DevOps&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=speaker-video-tdoc-global-2024-devops-transformation-pillar-page

----

videoTitle: Create Managed Azure DevOps Pools with Terraform
videoDescription:
Today we're working with Azure Pipelines and exploring the different options you have when working with agent pools. The main focus will be on the new Azure Managed DevOps Agent Pools, what they are, how they work, and why you might want to use them.

We’ll start by deploying some prerequisites using Terraform, including a virtual network to host our agents. You’ll see how to use the AzAPI provider to get the job done and I’ll walk you through it all, step by step, as we build this Terraform project from scratch.

Once everything is up and running, we’ll connect our agent to an Azure Pipeline and run a deployment to test it out.

If you’re looking to automate Azure DevOps agent pool provisioning with Terraform and AzAPI, or just want to learn more about CI/CD in Azure, you’re in the right place. Hope you enjoy the video!

videoTitle: Azure DevOps GitHub Integration with 2-way Sync and Real-Time Updates
videoDescription:
Here's how to quickly set up a secure, seamless 2-way integration that keeps your development teams in sync between Azure DevOps and GitHub. 

00:00 - Use Case
00:30 - Sync Demo
01:30 - Connect to Unito
02:00 - Flow Direction
02:25 - Set Rules and Triggers
02:51 - Linking Fields and Configurations

✨Try it free today:✨
🔗 https://bit.ly/3tAQXYN

Unito supports essential fields in Azure DevOps and GitHub, including:

💼 Title: The title or summary of the issue or work item provides a brief description of what the task or issue entails.

📝 Description: The detailed description of the issue or work item, including any additional information or context needed for team members to understand the task.

👤 Assignee: The person responsible for completing the task or addressing the issue. Keeping the assignee field in sync ensures that the correct team member is aware of their responsibilities.

🔢 Status: The current status of the issue or work item, such as "To Do," "In Progress," or "Done." Syncing the status field helps everyone stay updated on the progress of tasks.

🔝 Priority: The priority level of the issue or work item, which helps determine its importance and urgency. Syncing the priority field ensures that team members are aligned on task prioritization.

📌 Work Item Type/Issue Type: The type of work item or issue, such as bug, feature, or task. Syncing this field provides clarity and consistency in categorizing different types of work.

🏷️ Labels/Tags: Categorizing issues or work items with labels or tags helps with organization and filtering. Keeping these fields in sync ensures consistent labeling across both platforms.

💬 Comments/Updates: Any comments or updates made on an issue or work item should be synced to provide real-time collaboration and visibility for everyone involved.

⏰ Due Date: If there is a specific deadline or due date associated with the task or issue, syncing this field helps the team stay on track and meet deadlines.

📎 Attachments: Any files or attachments related to the issue or work item should be synced to ensure easy access and collaboration.

------------

videoTitle: Cracking the DevOps Code: Courses & Certifications for Success
videoDescription:
Take the courses mentioned here, get certifications and do not forget to add these using our AI-Powered Resume Builder (https://pro.kudoswall.com)
Certifications for Employed DevOps Professionals:
AWS Certified DevOps Engineer: This certification from Amazon Web Services (AWS) validates your expertise in deploying, operating, and managing applications on the AWS platform.
Azure DevOps Engineer: Offered by Microsoft, this certification demonstrates your skills in designing and implementing DevOps practices using Azure technologies.
Google Cloud Professional DevOps Engineer: This certification focuses on designing, developing, and managing DevOps practices on the Google Cloud Platform.
Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA): Certified by the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), CKA validates your Kubernetes skills, which are crucial for container orchestration.
Certified Jenkins Engineer: Offered by CloudBees, this certification recognizes your proficiency in using Jenkins for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
Red Hat Certified Engineer in DevOps: This certification from Red Hat validates your skills in using Red Hat technologies for automating, managing, and optimizing DevOps processes.

Courses for Aspiring DevOps Engineers:
Introduction to DevOps Practices: Online platforms like Coursera, edX, and Udemy offer various introductory courses that cover the fundamental concepts and practices of DevOps.
Docker and Kubernetes Courses: Understanding containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes is essential. There are numerous courses available for beginners and advanced users.
Cloud Platform Courses (AWS, Azure, GCP): Learning the basics of cloud platforms and their DevOps-related services is crucial. Many platforms offer free and paid courses for beginners.
CI/CD Pipeline Courses: Courses on continuous integration and continuous delivery tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, and CircleCI are essential for automating software delivery.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Courses: Learning tools like Terraform and Ansible for automating infrastructure deployment is key for DevOps engineers.
Monitoring and Logging Courses: Understanding tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for monitoring and logging is vital.
Scripting and Programming Courses: Proficiency in scripting languages like Python and programming languages like Java can enhance your DevOps skills.
Security and Compliance Courses: DevOps engineers should also be well-versed in security practices. Courses on DevSecOps and security automation can be beneficial.
#DevOpsIndia #Certifications #Courses #TechSkills #CareerGrowth #Cloud #Automation

videoTitle: D365 F&O: Setup an Azure DevOps CI Build Pipeline | Part 7
videoDescription:
Set up a CI pipeline for D365 in Azure DevOps. Learn to deploy a Build VM and automate your code builds for team development.

───────────
🕒 Timestamps
───────────

0:00 → Intro: Why We Need a CI Pipeline (Continuous Integration)
0:25 → Part 1: Create a Self-Hosted Agent Pool in ADO
1:19 → Part 2: Provision the Build VM in LCS
1:54 → Selecting the "Build and Test" Topology
2:24 → Advanced Settings: Linking the ADO Agent Pool & Branch
3:04 → Selecting the VM Size (Memory Optimized)
3:47 → Part 3: Configure the Build VM (Reset Password & Connect)
4:24 → Exploring the Build VM File Structure (SDK Folder)
4:53 → Part 4: Review the Auto-Generated Build Pipeline
5:43 → Enabling Continuous Integration Triggers & Path Filters
6:23 → Part 5: Branching Strategy (Rename 'dev' to 'Main')
6:52 → Connecting Visual Studio to Source Control (Team Explorer)
7:19 → Mapping a Local Workspace
7:55 → Adding the Local Project to Source Control
8:34 → Adding the axmodulesbuild File & Checking In
9:12 → Part 6: Creating a New 'dev' Branch from 'Main'
10:06 → Part 7: How the CI Build Process Works
10:23 → Reviewing the Build Stages (Build, Sync, Package)
10:59 → Under the Hood: Pipeline Tasks vs. VM Scripts
11:53 → Part 8: Reviewing the Final Build Artifact
12:27 → Recap

──────────────
💡 What You'll Learn
──────────────

✓ Create a self-hosted Agent Pool in Azure DevOps for D365 builds.
✓ How to deploy a Build VM from LCS and connect it to your pipeline.
✓ Configure an auto-generated build pipeline with CI triggers and path filters.
✓ Connect Visual Studio to Azure DevOps (TFVC) using Team Explorer.
✓ Check in your code to automatically trigger the build and create a Deployable Package.

──────────────────────────
🚀 About This D365 Development Series
──────────────────────────

This series goes beyond basic tutorials to show you how real-world Dynamics 365 (D365FO) projects are built from start to finish. We'll build a complete, end-to-end "Automated Customer Tiering System" for a fictional client, Bluestone Industrial Components (BIC).

You'll see every step of a production-ready solution, from setup to deployment, covering:
➤ Core X++ Development: Extending tables and forms (CustTable), creating Enums, and implementing custom business logic using Chain of Command (CoC).
➤ Automation: Building robust, automated batch jobs with the SysOperation Framework.
➤ APIs & Integration: Creating Data Entities to build secure OData REST APIs and for Data Management Framework (DMF) exports.
➤ Event-Driven Architecture: Firing real-time alerts from D365 to Azure Logic Apps using Business Events.
➤ Business Intelligence: Connecting D365 to Power BI to build an interactive sales dashboard.
➤ DevOps & ALM: Setting up a complete CI/CD pipeline in Azure DevOps, managing source control (TFVC), and automating builds.

────────────────
💻 Tools & Technologies
────────────────

🔹Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365FO)
🔹X++
🔹Visual Studio 2019
🔹Lifecycle Services (LCS)
🔹Azure DevOps (ADO)
🔹SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
🔹Power BI Desktop
🔹Azure Logic Apps

───────────────────
💬 Feedback & Future Topics
───────────────────

This series covers the core components of a practical, end-to-end D365 project. I know there are many more topics we could dive into, from advanced debugging to complex form patterns.

I welcome your feedback and ideas! If there's a specific D365 topic you'd like to see covered in a future video, please share your suggestions in the comments section below.

#Dynamics365, #AzureDevOps, #ContinuousIntegration, #D365Development

videoTitle: How We Fixed a 502 Bad Gateway in Production | Real DevOps Incident (Day 7)
videoDescription:
🚨 Day 7 of the DevOps in ARIA – Real-Time Scenario Series

Scenario:
Production just went down with a 502 Bad Gateway after a critical deployment. Jenkins pipeline triggered it, the deployment failed — and users were impacted.

🎯 Here’s how we handled it in real time:

Checked logs — the app was failing health checks

Root cause: a missing production environment variable

Rolled back the deployment safely using Helm

Fixed the configuration and stopped further rollouts

Patched the CI/CD pipeline to catch such issues early

🎥 Watch this short video to learn how real DevOps teams fix issues fast under pressure — and how you can too.

Takeaway:
Handling incidents is not just about tools — it’s about staying calm, investigating smartly, and improving your pipeline for the future.

💬 Have you faced a 502 in production? How did you resolve it? Let’s share and learn from each other in the comments.

videoTitle: What is Git? How would you define Git? || #GitHub #GitLab #BitBucket #DevOps #Git #Python #Java
videoDescription:
What is Git?

How would you define Git?

Well, Git is a distributed version control system, which means two things:

1. It's distributed so people around the world can share code
2. It does version control

So, with version control, you can take snapshots of the state of your current code and maintain a history.

Branching is really the third thing. Git branches allow developers to do isolated development and take chances without messing up the main branch.

So when someone asks me 'What is Git?', that is how I typically respond.

videoTitle: SBOM & Security Scanning in CI/CD | Secure Your DevOps Pipeline with GitHub Actions
videoDescription:

In this video, we take CI/CD security to the next level by integrating SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) generation and advanced security scanning into your GitHub Actions workflow. If you're only scanning container images for vulnerabilities, you're missing hidden risks! 😱

For Interview related training please feel free to reach us over the call 9845421738 to discuss further.

I am gonna tell you what DevOps engineers do in less than a minute with an example.

In a restaurant kitchen, there are chefs and wait staff.

Chefs are responsible for creating and experimenting with new dishes. Their job includes coming up with innovative recipes, testing them, and adding the successful ones to the menu. At the same time, they also prepare food to meet the regular demand of customers who visit the restaurant daily. This dual responsibility of innovation and ongoing service can become overwhelming, especially during busy hours when the kitchen is already at full capacity.

Wait staff, on the other hand, focus on delivering the prepared food to customers. Their primary role is to ensure that the food reaches the diners promptly and in perfect condition, keeping the restaurant’s operations running smoothly.

Experimenting with a new dish during peak hours, however, becomes a significant challenge. The process of testing new recipes while maintaining the flow of regular orders often leads to disruptions in the kitchen, causing delays and dissatisfaction among customers.

To address this, the restaurant hires a kitchen manager. The kitchen manager creates a separate small kitchen dedicated to experimenting with new dishes. This ensures that the chefs can focus on their innovations without interfering with the ongoing operations. Once a dish is perfected, the kitchen manager introduces automation, such as using a conveyor belt, to streamline the cooking process. This allows the new dish to be produced efficiently alongside the existing menu items while ensuring there are no interruptions in serving food to the restaurant's customers.

Yes, DevOps engineers are none other than automation experts.

videoTitle: What's the goal of Platform Engineering? #shorts #devops #platformengineering
videoDescription:
Watch the full video: https://youtu.be/JAblex0uS4k

What’s the goal of Platform Engineering? Platform Engineering focusses on the building the infrastructure and the systems that are needed for running your applications and supporting your application throughout the software life cycle. So,  the goal  is to support the developers in the organisation and treat them as customers. That’s why we have in platform engineering the concept of IDP Internal developer platform.
 
So, this platform is treated as an actual product and the customers of the product are the developers.
What is the role of the IDP?
It is to create a thin layer on top of the toolchain that is used inside the organisation to standardise the processes and help developers to have one way to deploy into production
